noun.description: A member of a North and Central American Indian people, formerly living in western New Mexico.
Archaeology. A culture of south-western New Mexico and south-eastern Arizona which flourished 100 b.c.–a.d. 1400. Usually with the.

adjective.description: Of or relating to the Apache Mogollons.
Archaeology. Of or relating to the Mogollon.

origin: Mid 19th century. From the names of the MogollonRim, Arizona, and the MogollonMountains, New Mexico, both from the name of Juan Ignacio Flores Mogollón, governor of New Mexico 1712–15.
